msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

div1.p: FILE No. 4544
Territory of Washington County of King } ss.
In the matter of the application of Michael Henan for discharge on a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Petition
To the Honorable Roger S. Greene Judge of the District Court, for the third judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Seattle. -

1 Your petitioner Michael Henan humbly represents to your Honor that he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty by J.H. McGraw Sheriff and jailer of said King County, and at the jail in the said County; the said jail being the County jail-
2 That the cause or pretense of your petitioners restraint is a charge of grand larceny, of which your petitioner avers that he is not guilty.
3 That the illegality of your petitioners restraint consists
in detaining your petitioner without evidence or facts sufficient to justify the same.
4 That your petitioner is a young man and is desirous of establishing his innocence at an early a date as possible. -

5 That your petitioner is ill & very ill in the said jail, - your petitioner being sorely - afflicted with a complaint which will, added to much longer imprisonment to wit on the October term of your Honors sitting surely bring about such woful consequences that your petitioner cannot ever recover from the effects of the same. -

Wherefore your petitioner prays this Honorable Court to grant unto him the gracious Writ of Habeas Corpus commanding the said J.H. McGraw Sheriff and jailer as aforesaid to produce the body of this your petitioner before your honor

on same day certain, and also command the said J H McGraw to summon + bring forth the witnesses charging your petitioner with the offense for which he is deprived of his liberty, + then + there at such time as named by your honor, to enquire wherefore this your petitioner is so illegaly restrained of his liberty and your petitioner will pray for discharge etc.
Michael Henan by Jas. H. Lewis his atty at law + on behalf of said Henan
Territory of Washington County of King } ss.

Before me Luthene Christopher Gilman a notary public for and in King County Washington Territory appeared James H. Lewis who being duly sworn on oath deposes and says, that he is attorney for foregoing named petitioner Michael Henan & that this petition is made by him on behalf of said Henan, that he has read the foregoing petition, knows its contents + believes the same to be true -
Jas. H. Lewis Sworn to & subscribed before me this 20 day of August AD 1885 L. C. Gilman Notary Public for Washington Territory
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle, Washington Territory.
In re- Michael Henan Plaintiff. vs. J.H. McGraw for writ of Habeas Corpus Defendant.
COPY OF Petitioner
FILED AUG 21 1885 By James Seavey, Clerk. By James Ludlow, Deputy Clerk.
Jas. H. Lewis Attorneys for pett.
